documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
such  a  removal  will  cause
death. The FLO account of the wrongness of killing explains why this is so.
A patient who is permanently unconscious cannot have a future that she
would come to value, whatever her values. Therefore, according to the FLO
theory of the wrongness of killing, death could not, ceteris paribus, be a mis-
fortune to her. Therefore, removing the feeding tube or ventilator does not
wrong her.
By contrast, almost all people believe that it is wrong, ceteris paribus, to
wit
